column1: 3$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/21/2010 2:58:36 PM$Reviewer: Pgrad
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver) $4$4$4$My 12yo daughter has taken this med for the past 2 1/2 years. We have increased to 27mg per day (due to growth). We definitely notice a difference if she hasnt taken them for a day (lack of impulse control
column4: high energy). The tablets are small enough for her to swallow with minimal effort
column5: which is a plus! She has had a significant growth spurt as she nears puberty
column6: so difficult to tell if weight gain is due to the meds (I think mostly not). She does complain of headaches occasionally. Overall
column7: we have been satisfied with this medication.

column1: 4$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/2/2010 8:04:05 AM$Reviewer: suzette
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver) $4$4$5$My son is 13 now and he has been on other meds for his ADHD and they worked just as well as the Methylin ER so the switch to this medication was mostly for economical reasons (the co-pay for the other meds was too high).It keeps my son focused and less hyperactive throughout most of the day. However
column3: the one benefit I see to this med over the others is that his appetite has increased.  On the other meds
column4: he barely ate and he was under-weight for his age.  Now he has gained a few pounds and has grown a few inches in the last 6 months. I think we'll stick with this one for a while.

column1: 5$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/25/2010 11:05:41 AM$Reviewer: Aspie
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Awesome drug
column5: the least expensive - very smooth and lasts a good 6-8 hours
column6: so I take the IR in the afternoon as a booster.

column1: 6$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/12/2010 4:14:15 PM$Reviewer: None
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$4$"I'm 36 yrs old. ADD my whole life. I have taken Dexedrine
column4: and finally Vyvanse.  So far Methylin ER is the least ""edgy"".  Seems mild while still helping me focus at work. I haven't had wierd thoughts so far like on the other meds. Feel more ""normal""."

column1: i have two children diagnosed with ADHD

column1: 8$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/3/2008 6:54:05 AM$Reviewer: onetogo
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver) $5$5$5$Once my son started high school I knew he needed to be assessed for ADHD. In the first 5 weeks of the school year he was failing 3 classes. As soon as he started taking just 10mg of Methylin ER he could focus and made the honor roll. The effects last the entire school day. He struggles a bit to concentrate on homework
column3: but so far it's  manageable. He has put on 10 pound in 6 weeks though. He isn't hungry all day
column4: but pigs out in the evenings.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$3$4$As a 26 year old ADD sufferer
column3: my Ritalin prescription has worked well for focusing on regular daily tasks.  However
column4: I experience chest pains and faintness perhaps once a month.  My doctor suggested it wasn't a concern
column5: though it seems to be a drawback from the medicine's benefits.

column1: 12$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/29/2008 1:23:31 AM$Reviewer: proudmom0005
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver) $2$1$4$My son was diagnosed with ADHD July 2007.  I didn't think I would ever medicate my child in this way but I'm glad that I have because he is more focused and less aggressive (WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THIS MEDICATION).  In the short time since his diagnoses
column3: we have tried about 4 different medications and this particular drug has been the least effective. He acts as if he's not currently taking any medication.  In the 1 month that he's been on this drug he has shown severe aggression towards his 2 yr old brother and has been very whiny.  The medication that has been the most effective is Metadate CD.  He was doing great in school and wonderful with his little brother.  Starting tomorrow morning we're going to try Conterta but if this fails we'll go back to Metadate CD in a heartbeat.
